headline: Robinhood Markets (NasdaqGS:HOOD) Expands Buyback Plan With US$1.5 Billion Authorization
summary: Robinhood Markets (NasdaqGS:HOOD) saw its shares rise by 16% over the past month, driven by significant developments within the company and broader market trends. Notably, Robinhood bolstered its share repurchase program, completing the buyback of over 17 million shares and increasing its authorization to $1.5 billion. Additionally, Robinhood reported strong quarterly earnings, with a notable increase in both revenue and net income compared to the previous year. These corporate actions and...

headline: Robinhood Stock Slips on Report Morgan Stanley to Offer Crypto Trading
summary: Robinhood Markets posted better-than-anticipated first-quarter results but shares fell Thursday following a report that Morgan Stanley is planning to add cryptocurrency trading to its E*Trade platform.

raw.headline: Robinhood Stock Slips on Report Morgan Stanley to Offer Crypto Trading
raw.summary: Robinhood Markets posted better-than-anticipated first-quarter results but shares fell Thursday following a report that Morgan Stanley is planning to add cryptocurrency trading to its E*Trade platform.

headline: Robinhood’s Chief Financial Officer Plans Big Stock Sales
summary: Robinhood  Markets Chief Financial Officer Jason Warnick plans to sell up to $27 million of shares of the trading platform.  On Feb. 14, Warnick filed a so-called Rule 10b5-1 trading plan to sell up 525,000 Robinhood shares, the company disclosed in its first-quarter report with the Securities and Exchange Commission.  The company disclosure of Warnick’s plan notes that restricted stock units “convert into class A common stock on a one-for-one basis upon vesting and settlement,” which may mean some or all of the shares to be sold will be vested RSUs.

The company disclosure of Warnick’s plan notes that restricted stock units “convert into class A common stock on a one-for-one basis upon vesting and settlement,” which may mean some or all of the shares to be sold will be vested RSUs.

headline: Robinhood Stock Retreats As Earnings, Revenue Beat. Monthly Users Miss.

headline: These are the top 10 April stock purchases on Robinhood U.K.
summary: Investing.com -- In a month where investors in the U.K. continued to show strong appetite for technology and innovation-focused companies, Robinhood U.K. users once again leaned heavily into tech names like NVIDIA, Tesla, and Palantir (NASDAQ:PLTR), with lead analyst Dan Lane attributing the surge in demand to persistent enthusiasm around artificial intelligence and cryptocurrency.
